description: ASME B16.5 Weld Neck Flange - forged steel flange with integral tapered hub for butt welding to pipe. PURCHASED standard part.

engineering_analysis.what_is_this: Pipe flange for bolted connections - allows piping to be assembled/disassembled
engineering_analysis.manufacturing_method: Forged steel, then machined for bolt holes and facing
engineering_analysis.procurement: ALWAYS purchase from flange manufacturer - never fabricate in-house
engineering_analysis.why_weld_neck: Integral hub provides smooth stress transition, best for high-pressure/cyclic service

flange_types.weld_neck: WN - Tapered hub, butt-welded to pipe (this file)
flange_types.slip_on: SO - Slides over pipe, fillet welded both sides
flange_types.blind: BL - Solid, no bore, used to close pipe ends
flange_types.threaded: TH - NPT threaded bore, screws onto pipe
flange_types.socket_weld: SW - Socket bore, pipe inserts and is fillet welded
flange_types.lap_joint: LJ - Used with stub ends, ring floats on stub

why_this_plane: Right plane allows revolve around vertical axis, then add bolt holes on face

6in_150lb_wn_rf.description: 6 inch Class 150 Weld Neck Raised Face Flange

4in_150lb_wn_rf.description: 4 inch Class 150 Weld Neck Raised Face Flange

steps.description: Start sketch on Right plane for revolve profile
Draw vertical centerline for revolve axis
Line 1: Inner bore - bottom to top
Line 2: Top of flange - bore to RF edge
Line 4: Top face to flange OD
Line 5: Flange OD - down to hub transition
Line 8: Close profile at pipe end
Revolve profile 360 degrees to create flange body
Start sketch on flange face for bolt holes
Draw first bolt hole at 3 o'clock position
Cut first bolt hole through flange
Pattern bolt hole around flange (8 holes for 6in 150#)

notes: Weld neck flange is ALWAYS a purchased part - never fabricate
Bolt hole count and size determined by flange class, not arbitrary
RF (Raised Face) height is standard 1/16" for Class 150/300
Hub taper provides smooth stress transition at weld joint
Bore ID matches pipe ID for smooth flow - specify schedule when ordering
Material typically A105 (carbon steel) or A182 (stainless/alloy)

common_errors.why_wrong: WN flanges have tapered hub - that's what makes them 'weld neck'
common_errors.correct_approach: Hub OD at large end > hub OD at small (pipe) end

common_errors.why_wrong: Bolt count is per ASME B16.5 table, based on size and class
common_errors.correct_approach: Look up correct count: 6" 150# = 8 bolts, 6" 300# = 12 bolts
